isis.stitle: TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR - CONNECTOR REPAIR - DEUTSCH CONNECTORS

svcsubproc.title: HD Series Connectors Contact Removal
svcsubproc.para: The Deutsch heavy-duty connectors used are designed to seal against moisture and contaminants. They also protect against damage from shock and vibration. The Deutsch part numbering system provides a complete description of the connector. A complete explanation is provided in Figure 20, Figure 21, and Figure 22.

figure.caption: Deutsch Connectors
Deutsch Part Numbering System
Deutsch HD10 Part Numbering System

step1.para: To remove the damaged contact, snap an appropriate size plastic contact repair tool over the wire of the contact to be removed ( Figure 23). If the wire to the contact is broken off, insert the tool into the applicable cavity over the contact. Use a Deutsch tool or equivalent.

figure.caption: Contact Removal and Removal Tools

step1.para: Slide the tool into the cavity over the contact until resistance is felt (locking fingers released) as shown in Figure 24.

figure.caption: Slide Tool into Cavity Over Contact

step1.para: Pull the contact/wire/tool assembly out of the connector ( Figure 25).

figure.caption: Pull Contact/Wire/Tool Assembly Out of Connector

svcsubproc.title: HD Series Connector Contact And Wire Assembly
svcsubproc.para: Contact and wire assembly is performed as follows:

step1.para: Strip 0.253 ± 0.031 inch [approximately 1/4 inch (6.3 mm)] of insulation from end of wire using suitable stripping tool.

Position contact into Deutsch HDT-4800 hand crimping tool (or equivalent) so that the crimp barrel is 1/32 inch (0.8 mm) above the tool indenters ( Figure 26). Hold contact in place by hand or by lightly squeezing the tool.

figure.caption: Position Contact into Hand Crimping Tool

step1.para: Place the stripped end of the wire into the crimp barrel of the contact. Fully depress the tool handles. Release and remove wire/contact assembly ( Figure 27).

figure.caption: Release and Remove Wire/Contact Assembly

step1.para: Inspect the wire/contact terminal to make sure that all wire strands are in the crimp barrel and that the crimp is secure ( Figure 28).

figure.caption: Inspect Wire/Contact Terminal

step1.para: Grasp the contact/wire assembly, between the thumb and forefinger, on the wire approximately one inch (25 mm) behind the contact crimp barrel ( Figure 29).

figure.caption: Grasp Contact/Wire Assembly Between Thumb and Forefinger

step1.para: Hold the connector with the grommet facing the contact ( Figure 30).

figure.caption: Hold Connector With Grommet Facing Contact

step1.para: Push the contact straight into the appropriate cavity in the connector grommet until a positive stop is felt. The retaining fingers in the connector will snap behind the shoulder of the contact and lock it in place. A slight tug backward on the wire will verify that the contact is properly seated ( Figure 31).

figure.caption: Push Contact Straight into Appropriate Cavity

svcsubproc.title: DRC Connectors (With Cat. 3176 & PEEC III) Contact Removal
svcsubproc.para: The Deutsch DRC connector used with International vehicles and Caterpillar electronically controlled engines is a heavy duty environmentally sealed connector.
The Deutsch part numbering system provides a complete description of the connector. The part number takes the form of DRC 14 - 40 P A - XXX. A complete explanation is included in Figure 32.

figure.caption: DRC Connector Part Numbering System

svcsubproc.para: Since contacts are removed and installed from the rear of the connector (as opposed to the mating end), the illustrations are shown from the rear of the connector.

step1.para: With the connector rear insert toward you, snap the appropriate size extractor tool (Deutsch Part No. 0411-204-1605) over the wire of terminal to be removed ( Figure 33).

figure.caption: Snap Tool Over Wire of Terminal to be Removed

step1.para: Slide extractor tool along wire straight into connector cavity until it contacts terminal and resistance is felt ( Figure 34).

figure.caption: Slide Extractor Tool Along Wire Straight into Connector Cavity

note.para: Do not twist or insert tool at an angle.

step1.para: Pull terminal/wire assembly out of the connector ( Figure 35).

figure.caption: Pull Terminal/Wire Assembly Out of Connector

step1.para: Inspect terminal.
Terminal should be clean, free of corrosion or damage, and secured to wire. The terminal/wire assembly should withstand a 30 lbs. pull-test.

svcsubproc.para: The wire in the terminal should be visible in the inspection hole ( Figure 36). All of the wire strands should enter the terminal and not be damaged or missing. Replace terminal if it does not meet these conditions.

figure.caption: Wire in Terminal Should Be Visible in Inspection Hole

svcsubproc.title: DRC Connectors (With Cat. 3176 & PEEC III) Terminal Installation
svcsubproc.para: If a new terminal is to be installed, follow this procedure to install the terminal to the wire.

note.para: This connector contains two different terminals. Those terminals attached to 14 gauge wires are International part number 1659751C1. Those terminals attached to 16 gauge wires are International part number 1651969C1. (International circuit diagrams indicate wire gauge.)

step1.para: Strip 1/4 inch (6.3 mm) insulation from wire.
Raise Crimp Tool (Deutsch HDT-4800) selector knob and rotate until arrow is aligned with wire size to be crimped ( Figure 37).

figure.caption: Rotate Selector Knob

step1.para: Loosen lock nut and turn adjusting screw in until it stops.
Insert terminal ( Figure 38) and turn adjusting screw counterclockwise out until terminal is flush with indenter cover. Tighten lock nut.

figure.caption: Insert Terminal

step1.para: Insert wire into terminal; terminal must be centered between indicators. Close handles until handle contacts the stop ( Figure 39). Release handles and remove crimped terminal.

figure.caption: Insert Wire into Terminal

step1.para: Inspect the terminal.
Terminal should be clean, free of corrosion or damage, and secured to wire. The terminal/wire assembly should withstand a 30 lbs. pull-test.

The wire in the terminal should be visible in the inspection hole ( Figure 36). All of the wire strands should enter the terminal and not be damaged or missing. Replace terminal if it does not meet these conditions.

svcsubproc.title: DRC Connectors (With Cat. 3176 & PEEC III) Terminal Insertion Into Connector

step1.para: Grasp wire about 1 inch (25 mm) behind terminal barrel ( Figure 40).

figure.caption: Grasp Wire About 1 Inch Behind Terminal Barrel

step1.para: Hold connector with rear grommet facing you and push contact straight into connector grommet ( Figure 41) until a positive stop is felt. A slight tug (10 lbs.) will confirm that it is properly locked in place.

figure.caption: Push Contact Straight into Connector Grommet
